articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexican drug lord Ovidio Guzman has reached a plea deal with U.S. authorities over drug trafficking charges he faced in the Northern District of Illinois, U.S. court records showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Mexican cartel leader Ovidio Guzman reaches plea agreement over drug trafficking charges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Multiple loud explosions were heard in several places in Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir on Wednesday as India said it had attacked "terrorist infrastructure" in nine sites and Pakistan vowed to respond to the attacks.
articles.title: India says it attacked nine sites in Pakistan, Pakistani Kashmir

articles.author: David Ljunggren, Steve Holland
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney visited the White House on Tuesday for his first talks with Donald Trump and bluntly told the U.S. president that Canada would never be for sale.
articles.title: Carney meets Trump for first time, stresses Canada will never be for sale

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: A U.S. judge declined on Tuesday to allow an Iranian-born engineer to be released on bail while he awaits trial on charges related to a deadly drone attack on a U.S. military base in Jordan carried out by Iran-backed militants last year.
articles.title: Iran-born engineer denied bail ahead of US trial tied to drone strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Multiple explosions and fires were seen and heard in Sudan's capital Port Sudan early on Tuesday, a witness said, though the exact locations and causes were unclear, as a civil war rocks the previously quiet city for the third day.
articles.title: Explosions heard in Sudanese city of Port Sudan, witness says

articles.author: Steve Holland, Jarrett Renshaw, Doina Chiacu
articles.description: President Donald Trump announced on Tuesday the U.S. will stop bombing the Houthis in Yemen, saying that the Iran-aligned group had agreed to stop interrupting important shipping lanes in the Middle East.
articles.title: Trump says US will stop bombing Houthis after agreement struck

articles.author: Madeline Chambers, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz was elected chancellor by parliament on Tuesday in a second round of voting after a humiliating and unprecedented defeat on the first attempt, getting his coalition government off to a wobbly start.
articles.title: Conservative Merz elected German chancellor after initial debacle

articles.author: Mohammed Ghobari
articles.description: The Israeli military said it fired on Yemen's main airport on Tuesday and witnesses said there were four strikes in the capital Sanaa, the latest hostilities as tensions rise between Israel and Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthi rebels.
articles.title: Israel says it struck Yemen's main airport in Sanaa

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's plan to expand its Gaza offensive, displace people within the enclave and take control of aid distribution has horrified Gazans who have already suffered multiple displacements and food shortages during 19 months of conflict.
articles.title: 'What's left to bomb?' Israel's plan to expand campaign strikes fear into Gazans

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India said it attacked nine sites in Pakistan including in the disputed territory of Kashmir on Wednesday in response to the killing of 26 people, mostly tourists, on its part of Kashmir last month that it blamed on Pakistan.
articles.title: India and Pakistan's history of strife
